title: In a study of the processions within the play, Marissa Greenberg demonstrates another way that Shakespeare and Fletcher foreshadowed Anne’s eventual execution. By making the Duke of Buckingham’s procession toward his execution the first procession of the play, the playwrights link the idea of procession with death. Much like her joyful coronation procession, Anne would make a much sadder procession to the Tower to await her execution in 1536

title: cunt” is a vile insult in both the United States and the United Kingdom. Its earliest use was for female genitalia, but circa 1400 an English translation of Lanfranc of Milan’s Chirurgia Magna (Science of Chirurgie, 1296) uses it as a clinical term. While risqué enough to occasion laughter in Shakespeare’s day, its earliest documented use as a term of abuse for women is in 1663 in the diary of Samuel Pepys, who—in a creepy coincidence—once kissed the lips of Katherine’s exhumed corpse.
